Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery open vessel, probably a Nikosthenic pyxis; interior glazed black; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of parts of two figures to left: on left chiton-wearer (foldless chiton with x’s, part of ornamented border at bottom, and himation with two folds, one added red dot; border decorated as on chiton with staggered half-circles between double lines); to right, raised male leg; inscription vertically between figures.
Curator's comments: For parallels, see Oxford AN1896-1908-G.137.50 (CVA Oxford pl. III, no. 18 (GB 404)).
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B601.9)

Smith C 1888 / Acquisitions of British Museum (p. 234, no. 17)
Lyon 2009 / Nikosthenic Pyxides between Etruria and Greece (p. 176, no. 20)
